solution_line_template: The cats they took in increased the number to {newly_taken_in_cats} + {initial_cats} = <<{newly_taken_in_cats}+{initial_cats}={cats_after_intake}>>{cats_after_intake} cats.
Three cats were adopted, so they had {cats_after_intake} - {adopted_cats} = <<{cats_after_intake}-{adopted_cats}={cats_after_adoption}>>{cats_after_adoption} cats.
One cat had {kittens} kittens, which increased the number of cats to {cats_after_adoption} + {kittens} = {cats_after_kittens} cats.
The pet owner came to get his missing cat, so they now have {cats_after_kittens} - {missing_pet_returned} = <<{cats_after_kittens}-{missing_pet_returned}={final_cats}>>{final_cats} cats.
